title: Improve Workspace Design, Access, and Editing with Bookmarks

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good reason to use bookmarks?
options: Access: As a marker for quick access to a specific section of a workspace
Design: As a way to subdivide a workspace and manage those sections
Editing: As a means to move groups of transformers at a time
Performance: As a means to improve workspace performance when caching data
Stability: As a way to reduce the likelihood of errors when running the workspace.

questions.question: Adding a bookmark with multiple objects selected will ensure the new bookmark contains the selected objects.
Bookmarks cannot have their color changed after they are added.
Bookmarks can be placed or “nested” inside one another.
Clicking a bookmark in the Navigator will take you to that section of the workspace.
Bookmarks can be used to make moving large sections of workspaces easier.
